text:
Hi,  I trying to run the chain-tests as mentioned in <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/tree/master/sdk/node#getting-set-up>. But getting below error.
Any idea what exactly is the issue?

Command - "node test/unit/chain-tests.js | node_modules/.bin/tap-spec"
Error - 
bash: node_modules/.bin/tap-spec: No such file or directory
module.js:338
    throw err;
          ^
Error: Cannot find module './lib/hlc'
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (module.js:336:15)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:278:25)
    at Module.require (module.js:365:17)
    at require (module.js:384:17)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric/sdk/node/index.js:20:18)
    at Module._compile (module.js:460:26)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:478:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:355:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:310:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:365:17)

attachments.title: hyperledger/fabric
attachments.text: fabric - Fabric is a blockchain project in Incubation proposed to the community and documented at <https://goo.gl/RYQZ5N>. Information on what Incubation entails can be found in the Hyperledger Proj...

text: <@U1EE1TRQE>:  I think the problem is that the version published in npm uses “hfc” instead of “hlc”. The master branch in GitHub is still “hlc”. There’s a PR <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/pull/2042>, but I can’t merge it because I need <@U0S5KF44D> to rebase. Perhaps you could use the previous version of the library published in NPM?
